37 template <typename T>
38 class in_place_storage
39 {
40 public:
44  in_place_storage() {}
45 
49  ~in_place_storage() = default;
50 
53  in_place_storage(const in_place_storage&) = delete;
54  in_place_storage& operator=(const in_place_storage&) = delete;
62  in_place_storage(in_place_storage&& other)
63  {
64  move(std::move(other));
65  }
66 
74  in_place_storage& operator=(in_place_storage&& other)
75  {
76  move(std::move(other));
77 
78  return *this;
79  }
80 
86  void* getStorage()
87  {
88  return &m_inPlace;
89  }
90 
96  T* getObject()
97  {
98  return reinterpret_cast<T*>(&m_inPlace);
99  }
100 
106  const T* getObject() const
107  {
108  return reinterpret_cast<const T*>(&m_inPlace);
109  }
110 
111 private:
112  void move(in_place_storage&& other)
113  {
114  new (&m_inPlace) T(std::move(*other.getObject()));
115  other.getObject()->~T(); // ensure that destructor of object in original storage is called
116  }
117 
118  typename std::aligned_storage<sizeof(T), alignof(T)>::type m_inPlace;
119 };
120 
124 template <typename T>
125 class heap_storage
126 {
127 public:
131  heap_storage() : m_heap(nullptr) {}
132 
136  ~heap_storage()
137  {
138  delete [] m_heap;
139  m_heap = nullptr;
140  }
141 
146  heap_storage(const heap_storage&) = delete;
147  heap_storage& operator=(const heap_storage&) = delete;
155  heap_storage(heap_storage&& other)
156  {
157  move(std::move(other));
158  }
159 
167  heap_storage& operator=(heap_storage&& other)
168  {
169  move(std::move(other));
170 
171  return *this;
172  }
173 
181  void* getStorage()
182  {
183  if (m_heap == nullptr)
184  m_heap = new unsigned char [sizeof(T)];
185 
186  return m_heap;
187  }
188 
194  const T* getObject() const
195  {
196  return reinterpret_cast<const T*>(m_heap);
197  }
198 
204  T* getObject()
205  {
206  return reinterpret_cast<T*>(m_heap);
207  }
208 
209 private:
210  void move(heap_storage&& other)
211  {
212  m_heap = other.m_heap;
213  other.m_heap = nullptr;
214  }
215 
216  unsigned char* m_heap;
217 };
218 
222 template <typename T, typename STORAGE>
223 class optional_holder
224 {
225 public:
229  constexpr optional_holder() noexcept
230  {}
231 
235  constexpr optional_holder(NullOptType) noexcept
236  {}
237 
243  optional_holder(const T& value)
244  {
245  new (getStorage()) T(value);
246  m_hasValue = true;
247  }
248 
254  optional_holder(T&& value)
255  {
256  new (getStorage()) T(std::move(value));
257  m_hasValue = true;
258  }
259 
265  optional_holder(const optional_holder<T, STORAGE>& other)
266  {
267  if (other.hasValue())
268  {
269  new (getStorage()) T(*other.m_storage.getObject());
270  m_hasValue = true;
271  }
272  }
273 
279  optional_holder(optional_holder<T, STORAGE>&& other)
280  {
281  if (other.hasValue())
282  {
283  m_storage = std::move(other.m_storage);
284  other.m_hasValue = false;
285  m_hasValue = true;
286  }
287  }
288 
292  ~optional_holder()
293  {
294  reset();
295  }
296 
304  optional_holder<T, STORAGE>& operator=(const optional_holder<T, STORAGE>& other)
305  {
306  if (this != &other)
307  {
308  reset();
309  if (other.hasValue())
310  {
311  new (getStorage()) T(*other.m_storage.getObject());
312  m_hasValue = true;
313  }
314  }
315 
316  return *this;
317  }
318 
326  optional_holder& operator=(optional_holder<T, STORAGE>&& other)
327  {
328  if (this != &other)
329  {
330  reset();
331  if (other.hasValue())
332  {
333  m_storage = std::move(other.m_storage);
334  other.m_hasValue = false;
335  m_hasValue = true;
336  }
337  }
338 
339  return *this;
340  }
341 
349  optional_holder& operator=(const T& value)
350  {
351  set(value);
352 
353  return *this;
354  }
355 
363  optional_holder& operator=(T&& value)
364  {
365  set(std::move(value));
366 
367  return *this;
368  }
369 
377  bool operator==(const optional_holder<T, STORAGE>& other) const
378  {
379  if (this != &other)
380  {
381  if (hasValue() && other.hasValue())
382  return *(m_storage.getObject()) == *(other.m_storage.getObject());
383 
384  return (!hasValue() && !other.hasValue());
385  }
386 
387  return true;
388  }
389 
395  explicit operator bool() const noexcept
396  {
397  return hasValue();
398  }
399 
407  const T& operator*() const
408  {
409  return *get();
410  }
411 
419  T& operator*()
420  {
421  return *get();
422  }
423 
431  const T* operator->() const
432  {
433  return get();
434  }
435 
443  T* operator->()
444  {
445  return get();
446  }
447 
451  void reset() noexcept
452  {
453  if (hasValue())
454  {
455  m_storage.getObject()->~T();
456  m_hasValue = false;
457  }
458  }
459 
467  const T& value() const
468  {
469  return *get();
470  }
471 
479  T& value()
480  {
481  return *get();
482  }
483 
489  bool hasValue() const noexcept
490  {
491  return m_hasValue;
492  }
493 
494 private:
495  template <typename U = T>
496  void set(U&& value)
497  {
498  reset();
499  new (getStorage()) T(std::forward<U>(value));
500  m_hasValue = true;
501  }
502 
503  T* get()
504  {
505  checkHasValue();
506  return m_storage.getObject();
507  }
508 
509  const T* get() const
510  {
511  checkHasValue();
512  return m_storage.getObject();
513  }
514 
515  void* getStorage()
516  {
517  return m_storage.getStorage();
518  }
519 
520  void checkHasValue() const
521  {
522  if (!hasValue())
523  throw CppRuntimeException("Trying to access value of non-present optional field!");
524  }
525 
526  STORAGE m_storage;
527  bool m_hasValue = false;
528 };
529 
538 template <typename T>
539 struct is_optimized_in_place
540 {
541  static const bool value = (sizeof(in_place_storage<T>) <= 8 * sizeof(uint64_t) - sizeof(bool));
542 };
543 
549 template <typename T, bool IS_IN_PLACE>
550 struct optimized_optional_storage
551 {
552  typedef detail::in_place_storage<T> type;
553 };
554 
555 template <typename T>
556 struct optimized_optional_storage<T, false>
557 {
558  typedef detail::heap_storage<T> type;
559 };
562 } // namespace detail
563 
567 template <typename T>
568 using InPlaceOptionalHolder = detail::optional_holder<T, detail::in_place_storage<T>>;
569 
573 template <typename T>
574 using HeapOptionalHolder = detail::optional_holder<T, detail::heap_storage<T>>;
575 
576 // Be aware that if OptionalHolder is defined by typename, C++ compiler will have problem with template
577 // function overload, see HashCodeUtil.h (overloads for objects and for OptionalHolder).
582 template <typename T>
583 using OptionalHolder = detail::optional_holder<
584  T, typename detail::optimized_optional_storage<T, detail::is_optimized_in_place<T>::value>::type>;
585
